cons: office has a dank musty smell

pros: Experienced fundraising team, and a range of fundraising events.

Excellent working culture that is extremely compassionate and where everyone believes in the vision to improve the lives of people affected by Dementia and their families. Decision making is really effective and you feel like you can make a real difference Excellent 33 days holiday as standard
cons: The charity has grown really quickly and some of the processes are not always in place. But this is a known issue that is being worked through.

job_title: Supporter Care Officer in London, England
pros:
Everyone is kind, including the manager
Young workforce 
Great location as it is close to a zone 2 train station
Great views from the office
Good work life balance
cons: Not many social events to go

job_title: Communications and Fundraising Directorate in London, England
pros: Fundraising team at junior level are lovely
cons: Worst experience of a national charity, and I have worked at several now. CEO lovely but likely unaware of how employees are being treated, as there are some very blunt managers who did not understand what others have going on. Felt like there were not at all interested in looking after their employees - meetings focused on targets, money making so they could be the 'best' dementia charity and very rarely saw wellbeing checks or achievements. All from previous experience. Working here did not help my mental health in the long term, I still struggle massively in new jobs due to this life changing experience.

pros: It is a great company to work for
cons: I have no cons to share

pros: The people, the cause, the flexible working
cons: No progression, often not taken seriously by management

review_title: Decent place but very old working styles
job_title: Supporter Care Officer in London, England
pros: Great experience, the charity does amazing work for people who impacted by dementia
cons: Lacks integration and understanding of social issues I.e discrimination. Not an inclusive environment.

pros:
Friendly team - small enough that you can get to know everyone 
Incredible staff doing crucial work for those with dementia 
You can still influence and change ways of working
cons: Salary is not consistent across the organisation

review_title: A decent charity and office to work for
pros: Relaxed and quiet environment, decent pay and good office.
cons: Progression is pretty fixed and stagnated. Things take longer to progress and change.

job_title: Regional Fundraising Executive in London, England
pros:
Great training budget
Great management
Supportive team
Flexible working 
Culture and values are excellent
cons: Statutory  maternity leave which is not great
